title: How to Make Rice Stuffing

steps.headline: Mix the water, broth, and wild rice.
steps.description: In a large sauce pan, mix your water and chicken broth. Bring the pot to a boil over high heat. Then, mix in the rice. Cover the pot. Allow the rice, broth, and water to simmer for 45 minutes.

steps.headline: Cook the bacon.
steps.description: Place your bacon in a skillet. Turn the heat on your stove to medium-high. Cook the bacon, turning on occasion, until it's golden brown. When the bacon is cooked, remove it from the skillet. Allow the bacon to cool for a few minutes. Then, use your fingers to gently break the bacon apart into small crumbles. Keep any drippings from the bacon in the pot.

steps.headline: Saute the onion and celery.
steps.description: Saute the onions and celery in the bacon drippings. You should also add a tablespoon of water. Cook the onions and celery over medium-high heat. You want to get your vegetables very soft, which should take approximately 20 minutes of cooking. Turn your vegetables frequently while cooking them to prevent sticking and burning. Set the vegetable mixture aside when you're done.

steps.headline: Stir in the remaining ingredients.
steps.description: Add the white rice, remaining water, currants, cherries, cranberries, apricots, and apples to the wild rice mixture. Return your pot  to the stove and let everything cook until the white rice is soft. It should take about 20 minutes to cook, although times will vary depending on the precise heat of your stove.

steps.headline: Mix everything together.
steps.description: Add the bacon as well as the onion mixture to the rice. Mix everything together until you have an even, uniform mixture. You can then season your stuffing with the herbs and parsley. It is now ready to serve.

steps.headline: Saute your onions.
steps.description: Add four tablespoons of your butter to a heavy pan or pot. Allow the butter to melt over medium heat. Then, add your onions. Saute your onions until they're caramelized and extremely tender. This should take about 25 minutes. When your done, move your onions to a large bowl and set them aside for now.

steps.headline: Saute your mushrooms.
steps.description: Melt another four tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Add your mushrooms and one tablespoon of thyme and saute them in the butter. It should take around 12 minutes to completely cook your mushrooms. When you're done, they should have a deep brown color. Add the mushrooms to the same bowl as the onions when you're done. Season them using salt and pepper and then set them aside for now.

steps.headline: Boil the broth, thyme, and sage.
steps.description: Add your broth, as well as one tablespoon of thyme and two teaspoons of sage, to a large bowl. Bring the broth to a boil and then reduce the heat.

steps.headline: Mix in your wild rice with the broth.
steps.description: Once the rice is added, bring the broth to a boil again. Once it's boiling, reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover the saucepan and let everything simmer for 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Add your white rice.
steps.description: After 30 minutes have passed, add your white rice to the broth mixture. Cover the bowl again and let everything simmer until all the rice is tender and most of the liquid has been dissolved. This generally takes about 18 minutes, but check your rice frequently to make sure it does not burn.

steps.headline: Mix everything together.
steps.description: You can add your onions and mushrooms to the rice. You should also add the remaining spices, which are 1 tablespoon of thyme and one teaspoon of sage. You can also add the pears now.

steps.headline: Simmer for five minutes.
steps.description: Cover the pot and let the remaining ingredients simmer for five minutes. Stir the ingredients often while they're simmering. After the ingredients are cooked, add your parsley and season the stuffing with salt and pepper. It is now ready to serve.

steps.headline: Boil the rice and vegetable broth.
steps.description: Use a large saucepan to combine your vegetable broth and rice. Allow the mixture to come to a boil. Then, reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover the pot. Allow it to simmer for about 35 to 40 minutes. When the rice is done simmering, the broth should be completely absorbed.

steps.headline: Saute the onions and celery.
steps.description: Melt your coconut oil in a pot or a dutch oven over medium heat. Then, add your onions and celery to the oil. Cook the vegetables until their tender. This takes about 8 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the garlic, mushrooms, sage, thyme, and salt.
steps.description: Once these ingredients are added, saute everything for about 8 more minutes. Make sure to str often. This will prevent burning and mix everything evenly.

steps.headline: Combine your ingredients.
steps.description: Mix your vegetable mixture in with your rice. Stir until the ingredients are evenly combined. If necessary, adjust your seasonings to taste before serving.
